workflow.name: Voice translator bridge (Telegram ‚Üí Slack) with GPT-4o-mini + Whisper
workflow.description:
## üß† How it works  
This workflow automatically **transcribes and translates voice messages from Telegram to Slack**, enabling seamless communication between **Japanese** and **English** speakers.  

In our real-world use case, our distributed team often sends short voice updates on Telegram ‚Äî but most discussion happens on Slack.  
Before this workflow, we constantly asked:  
- ‚ÄúCan someone write a summary of that voice message?‚Äù  
- ‚ÄúI can‚Äôt understand what was said ‚Äî is there a transcript?‚Äù  
- ‚ÄúCan we translate this audio for our English-speaking teammates?‚Äù  

This workflow fixes that problem **without changing anyone‚Äôs communication habits**.  
Built with **n8n**, **OpenAI Whisper**, and **GPT-4o-mini**, it automatically:  
- Detects when a voice message is posted on Telegram  
- Downloads and transcribes it via Whisper  
- Translates the text with GPT-4o-mini  
- Posts the result in Slack ‚Äî with flags üáØüáµ‚Üíüá∫üá∏ and username attribution  


## ‚öôÔ∏è Features  
- üéß **Voice-to-text transcription** using **OpenAI Whisper**  
- üåê **Automatic JA ‚Üî EN detection and translation** via **GPT-4o-mini**  
- üí¨ Clean Slack message formatting with flags, username, and original text   
- üîß Easy to customize: adjust target languages, tone, or message style  
- ‚ö° Typical end-to-end time: under 10 seconds for short audio clips  


## üíº Use Cases  
- **Global teams** ‚Äì Send quick voice memos in Telegram and share readable translations in Slack  
- **Project coordination** ‚Äì Record updates while commuting and post bilingual notes automatically  
- **Remote check-ins** ‚Äì Replace daily written reports with spoken updates  
- **Cross-language collaboration** ‚Äì Let English and Japanese teammates stay perfectly synced  


## üí° Perfect for  
- **Bilingual creators and managers** working across Japan and Southeast Asia  
- **AI automation enthusiasts** who love connecting voice and chat platforms  
- **Teams using Telegram for fast communication** and Slack for structured workspaces  


## üß© Notes  
- Requires three credentials:  
  - `TELEGRAM_BOT_TOKEN`  
  - `OPENAI_API_KEY_HEADER`  
  - `SLACK_BOT_TOKEN_HEADER`  
- Slack scopes: `chat:write`, `files:write`, `channels:history`  
- You can **change translation direction or add languages** in the ‚ÄúDetect Language‚Äù ‚Üí ‚ÄúTranslate (OpenAI)‚Äù nodes.  
- Keep audio files under **25 MB** for Whisper processing.  
- Always export your workflow with **credentials OFF** before sharing or publishing.  


### ‚ú® Powered by  
**OpenAI Whisper** √ó **GPT-4o-mini** √ó **n8n** √ó **Telegram Bot API** √ó **Slack API**  
A complete multilingual voice-to-text bridge ‚Äî connecting speech, translation, and collaboration across platforms. üåç

workflow.name: Voice Translator Bridge (Telegram ‚Üí Slack) with GPT-4o-mini + Whisper

parameters.content:
### üéØ Purpose  
Downloads the actual `.oga` or `.mp3` file from Telegram.

### ‚öôÔ∏è Setup  
- Method: `GET`
- URL: `{{$json.file_url}}`
- **Send Binary Data:** ‚úÖ (ON)

### üß© Output  
Binary data under `$binary.data`

### üéØ Purpose  
Constructs the Telegram file URL for download.

### ‚öôÔ∏è Setup  
Use an **Expression**:
```
https://api.telegram.org/file/bot{{$credentials.telegramApi.accessToken}}/{{$json.file_path}}
```

### üß© Output  
`file_url` ‚Üí used in **Download Voice File**

### üéØ Purpose  
Starts the workflow when a **voice message** is received in Telegram.

### ‚öôÔ∏è Setup  
- Connect your **Telegram Bot Token** (Credential: `TELEGRAM_BOT_TOKEN`).
- This node listens for incoming messages (`audio`, `voice`, or `text`).

### üß© Output  
Contains:
- `message.from.username`
- `message.voice.file_id`
- Optional `message.text`

### üéØ Purpose  
Retrieve the Telegram voice file's metadata.

### ‚öôÔ∏è Setup  
- Input: `file_id` from the Trigger node  
- Calls Telegram API `getFile` to obtain the `file_path`.

### üß© Output  
`file_path` (used to build the actual download URL)

### üéØ Purpose  
Prepare binary audio data for the Whisper node.

### ‚öôÔ∏è Setup  
- Input: `$binary.data`
- Output: rename to `audio` (binary key expected by Whisper)

### üß© Output  
Binary ‚Üí `$binary.audio`

### üéØ Purpose  
Convert voice to text using **OpenAI Whisper**.

### ‚öôÔ∏è Setup  
- Credential: `OPENAI_API_KEY_HEADER`
- Resource: `Audio`
- Operation: `Transcribe a Recording`
- Input Data Field Name: `audio`

### ‚ö†Ô∏è Note  
Max file size = 25 MB.

### üéØ Purpose  
Detect source language from the transcription text.

### ‚öôÔ∏è Setup  
Simple **IF or Code node** to detect ‚Äúja‚Äù vs ‚Äúen‚Äù.  
Used later for flag direction (üáØüáµ‚Üíüá∫üá∏ or üá∫üá∏‚ÜíüáØüáµ).

### üéØ Purpose  
Translate transcribed text using **GPT-4o-mini**.

### ‚öôÔ∏è Setup  
- Request Method: POST  
- URL: `https://api.openai.com/v1/chat/completions`  
- Headers:
  ```json
  {
    "Authorization": "Bearer {{$credentials.OPENAI_API_KEY_HEADER}}",
    "Content-Type": "application/json"
  }
  ```
- Body (JSON/RAW):
  ```json
  {
    "model": "gpt-4o-mini",
    "temperature": 0.2,
    "messages": [
      { "role": "system", "content": "You are a translation engine. Translate accurately and clearly." },
      { "role": "user", "content": "Source language: {{$json.source_lang}}\nTarget language: {{$json.target_lang}}\nText:\n{{$json.text}}" }
    ]
  }
  ```

### üß© Output  
`choices[0].message.content` ‚Üí translated text

### üéØ Purpose  
Post the final translated message into Slack.

### ‚öôÔ∏è Setup  
- Authentication: `Header Auth`  
- Credential: `SLACK_BOT_TOKEN_HEADER`  
- URL: `https://slack.com/api/chat.postMessage`  
- JSON Body:
  ```json
  {
    "channel": "C09NT81DQU",
    "text": "{{$json.slack_text}}"
  }
  ```

### ‚úÖ Tip  
Use a test channel first (e.g., `#voice-bridge`) before production.

user.name: Tomohiro Goto
user.bio: Creative Technologist blending design and automation to make work a little more fun. Exploring how AI and workflow tools like n8n can bring creativity into everyday work.

data.details: The Function node allows you to execute JavaScript in your workflow. Unlike the Function Item node, this node does not operate on incoming node data per-item. Instead, you must iterate over multiple items of incoming data yourself. This can be useful if you're performing data transformation where you want to manipulate the number of items being outputted by the node (i.e. 1 item is inputted in with nested object, 10 items are outputted without any nested objects)

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
